intro: Odontoglossum cristatellum var. argus, commonly known as the Argus orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking, ornate flowers that feature intricate patterns resembling the eyespots of an argus butterfly. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are usually elongated and dark green, providing a lush backdrop for its showy blooms. This variety is prized by orchid enthusiasts for its unique appearance and relatively compact growth habit.
